metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23214 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When the server is configured to use trust authentication with a clientcert requirement or to use cert authentication, a man-in-the-middle attacker can inject arbitrary SQL queries when a connection is first established, despite the use of SSL certificate verification and encryption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> Plan is for postgresql-13 to be removed from jammy, marking as deferred for now.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
